bestBHT.bht: In his letter to the Thessalonians, Paul clarifies that he writes the salutation with his own hand as a token of authenticity and to distinguish his genuine letters from any counterfeits. By employing an amanuensis for the body of his epistles, Paul ensures the integrity of his message. This caution is driven by the early practice of presenting spurious writings under the apostles' name, and Paul's desire to protect the Thessalonians from being troubled by false letters purportedly from him. The autograph salutation serves as a sign to differentiate genuine epistles from forgeries.
